intro: Stephananthus junceus, commonly known as the silver grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, silver-tomentose leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance and drought tolerance.
